## Mining Scientific Papers: NLP-enhanced Bibliometrics {#mining-scientific-papers-nlp-enhanced-bibliometrics}

Traditional bibliometrics mainly uses metadata (titles, authors, references), but full-text processing allows for deeper analysis.

-   The rise of Open Access (OA) platforms (e.g., ArXiv, CiteSeer, PLOS) has opened new research directions.\
-   NLP techniques (e.g., NLTK, Mallet, OpenNLP, CiteSpace, AllenNLP) help extract knowledge from scientific texts.\
-   A key challenge is ensuring reproducibility through standardized annotated datasets and evaluation protocols.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Mining Scientific Papers, Volume II {#mining-scientific-papers-volume-ii}

The availability of full-text scientific papers in machine-readable formats has transformed bibliometric research.

-   Open Access (OA) platforms like ArXiv, Semantic Scholar, CiteSeer, and PLOS have facilitated large-scale text mining.\
-   NLP tools (e.g., Spacy, NLTK, Mallet, OpenNLP, CoreNLP) enable advanced text processing.
